body.p:
Head Qrs. 68th Regt Ky E. M.
Louisa May 26th 1864
Quartermaster General
State of Kentucky,
Sir

the 68th Regt Ky Enrolled Militia are now on duty at this post, under our order from the Governor calling them into the service for 30 days, we have no camp & Garrison Equipage. I made the enclosed requisition upon the Brigade Quartermaster at this post, he proposes to issue upon the requisition in the event the Governor will endorse his approval upon the requisition.

This is the second time this (68th) Regt. has been called into the service we have no means of procuring articles necessary for its use unless authority be given us to purchase. I would respectfully suggest that authority be given me to purchase such articles
as an necessary for the use of the Regiment upon the apporveal or order of the Col commanding.

I am Genrl
Your Obt Svt.
Thomas Wallace
Lt & Regt Q. M. 68th, Ky, E. M.

Ky State Militia
Louisa
Lawrence Co
May 26th 1864
Wallace Thos Qr Mr
68th Regt E. M.

Makes inquiry in regard to obtaining camp and garrison equipage for his Regt
Recd Q. M. G. O. June 1st /64.

68 EM
Office Q. M. G. Ky
June 1st 1864

S G Suddarth
Qe Mr Genl Ky
